t: Psalm 132
Prayer for the Lord’s Blessing upon the Sanctuary.
A Song of Ascents.
Remember,*pn O Lord,*s on David’s behalf, All*ln his affliction;
How*ln he swore to the Lord*s And*ln vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob,
“Surely*ln I will not enter my house, Nor*ln lie on my bed;
I*ln will not give sleep to my eyes Or*ln slumber to my eyelids,
Until*ln I find a place for the Lord,*s A*ln dwelling place for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
Behold,*ln we heard of it in Ephrathah, We*ln found it in the field of Jaar.
Let*ln us go into His dwelling place; Let*ln us worship at His footstool.
Arise,*ln O Lord,*s to Your resting place, You*ln and the ark of Your strength.
Let*ln Your priests be clothed with righteousness, And*ln let Your godly ones sing for joy.
For*ln the sake of David Your servant, Do*ln not turn away the face of Your anointed.
The*ln Lord*s has sworn to David A*ln truth from which He will not turn back: “Of*ln the fruit of your body I will set upon your throne.
If*ln your sons will keep My covenant And*ln My testimony which I will teach them, Their*ln sons also shall sit upon your throne forever.”
For*ln the Lord*s has chosen Zion; He*ln has desired it for His habitation.
“This*ln is My resting place forever; Here*ln I will dwell, for I have desired it.
I*ln will abundantly bless her provision; I*ln will satisfy her needy with bread.
Her*ln priests also I will clothe with salvation, And*ln her godly ones will sing aloud for joy.
There*ln I will cause the horn of David to spring forth; I*ln have prepared a lamp for Mine anointed.
His*ln enemies I will clothe with shame, But*ln upon himself his crown shall shine.”
